column1: #Text=Bulk polycrystalline samples of Sr3−xSnO, approximately 0.5 g in each batch, were synthesized by reaction of Sr chunk (Furuuchi, 99.9%) and SnO powder (Furuuchi, 99.9%) in an alumina crucible sealed inside a quartz tube under vacuum.
#Text=Preparations of synthesis were performed inside an Ar-filled glove box.
#Text=The sealed quartz tubes were heated to 800 °C over 3 h and kept at 800 °C for 3 h.
#Text=Then the tubes were immediately quenched in water and were opened inside the glove box.
#Text=The obtained samples were stored and prepared for measurements in the glove box.
#Text=A crude estimation of the amount of evaporated strontium by weight in batches A, B and C indicates that it was about 18% of the starting strontium amount.

#Text=In further investigations on the synthesis, we observed that the\revaporation of strontium can be suppressed to o1% if the reaction was carried\rout in glass tubes that were sealed under 0.3 bar of argon pressure at room\rtemperature instead of vacuum.
#Text=Batch D was synthesized in this way with\rSr2.46SnO as starting composition instead of Sr3SnO.\r(3) Batch E.
#Text=An excess of 25% strontium was used and the glass tube was sealed\runder vacuum for synthesis of batch E.
#Text=For this batch, a 100% yield of\rSr3SnO by weight with respect to the starting quantity of SnO was obtained.
#Text=This batch E was considered an almost stoichiometric Sr3SnO phase.

#Text=A sample\rfrom batch E, with approximately stoichiometric composition, showed\rsemiconducting resistivity behaviour down to low temperature, with an\ranomaly at 4K, suggesting an inclusion of a small superconducting region.
#Text=However, in the magnetic measurement, this sample did not show evidence of\rsuperconductivity down to 0.15 K.

#Text=The observed semiconducting behaviour\ragrees with the result from Sr3SnO thin-film reports18,19 and supports\rour claim that the Fermi level is shifted down in the bulk superconducting\rsamples.
